source_sentence: 爾時鄔陀夷聞佛世尊說伽他已，頂禮佛足白佛言：「世尊！
translation: After hearing the Bhagavān speak about the kāṭā, Udayin bowed his head at the Buddha's feet and said to him, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我欲還宮白父王知。」
translation: I want to return to the palace and tell my father that I know."

source_sentence: 佛告鄔陀夷：「為佛使者理不應然。」
translation: The Buddha told Udayin, "It's not right to be a messenger of the Buddha."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷白佛言：「為佛使者其事如何？」
translation: Udayin said to the Buddha, "What's the matter with being a messenger of the Buddha?"

source_sentence: 佛告鄔陀夷：「凡出家者方為佛使。」
translation: The Buddha told Udayin, "Only someone who leaves home will be a messenger of the Buddha."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷言：「我願出家，然為要契事須還報淨飯大王，我今且去。」
translation: Udayin said, "I'd like to leave home, but I have to return to King Jīvaka for an important purpose, so I'll leave now."

source_sentence: 佛言：「待出家已方報前信。」
translation: The Buddha said, "Only after becoming a householder will I be able to repay my former faith."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷言：「善哉！
translation: Udayin said, "Good!

source_sentence: 我今出家。」
translation: Now, I've left home."

source_sentence: 然而世尊為菩薩時，生生之處於二師二親及尊重類，有如法教令曾不違逆，由此因緣言無違者。
translation: Nevertheless, when the Bhagavān was a bodhisattva, there were places of birth where he taught and instructed the two teachers, two relatives, and respectful types according to the teaching that were never disobeyed, and this was the reason he said there was no disobedience.

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷白佛言：「我今出家。」
translation: Udayin said to the Buddha, "Now, I've left home."

source_sentence: 佛告舍利子：「汝與鄔陀夷出家，令其長夜永得利益。」
translation: The Buddha told Śāriputra, "Leave home with Udayin and make it possible for him to receive lasting benefit for a long time."

source_sentence: 舍利子言：「如是。」
translation: Śāriputra said, "So it is."

source_sentence: 世尊便與出家并受圓具，所有行法略並告知。
translation: The Bhagavān then went along with the renunciant, fully ordained, and told him briefly about all the practices.

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷既受教誡，禮舍利子已，詣世尊所禮佛雙足，白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Having been instructed, Udayi then paid homage to Śāriputra, went to the Bhagavān and bowed his feet to him, saying, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我已出家。」
translation: I've left home."

source_sentence: 佛言：「汝今可去，然而造次勿入王宮，宜至其門立而告曰：『釋迦苾芻今至門外。』
translation: The Buddha said, "Now, you may go, but do not enter the palace in order; instead, go to its entrance and stand there and tell it, 'Shakyamuni, come outside the entrance now.'

source_sentence: 若喚入者即應隨入。
translation: If you're called to enter, you should follow him in.

source_sentence: 彼若問言：『更有諸餘釋迦苾芻不？』
translation: If he asks, 'Are there any other Śākyamuni monks?'

source_sentence: 答言：『更有。』
translation: He replied, 'There's more.'

source_sentence: 若問：『一切義成太子亦作如是形狀耶？』
translation: If you ask, 'Does the prince Maitreya also have this shape?'

source_sentence: 答言：『亦作如是形狀。』
translation: He replied, 'So it is shaped.'

source_sentence: 汝亦不應宿王宮內。
translation: You also shouldn't stay at the king's palace.

source_sentence: 若問：『一切義成太子宿王宮不？』
translation: Suppose you ask, 'Does the prince Saṃyuktâgama stay at the king's palace?'

source_sentence: 答言：『不宿。』
translation: He answered, 'I won't stay overnight.'

source_sentence: 問：『何處宿止？』
translation: He asked, 'Where will I stay overnight?'

source_sentence: 答言：『或阿蘭若、或毘訶羅。』
translation: He replied, 'Perhaps it's araṇya or vihāra.'

source_sentence: 若問：『一切義成太子欲來此不？』
translation: If he asks, 'Does the prince Maitreya want to come here?'

source_sentence: 答言：『欲來。』
translation: He replied, 'I want to come.'

source_sentence: 若言：『何時欲來？』
translation: If he says, 'When do you want to come?'

source_sentence: 答言：『過七日後方來至此。』」
translation: He replied, 'I won't come here for another seven days.'"

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷禮佛而去。
translation: Udayin calms the Buddha and departs.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊神力加被，令鄔陀夷如申臂頃即至劫比羅城，立王門外告守門者曰：「為我白王：『釋迦苾芻今在門外。』」
translation: The Bhagavān then bestowed miraculous powers on Udayin and caused him to arrive at Kapilavastu in as short a time as his arm, stand outside the king's gate, and tell the gatekeeper, "Tell the king for me, 'The Śākyamunis are outside the gate now.'"

source_sentence: 門人問曰：「更有諸餘釋迦苾芻不？」
translation: The gatekeeper asked, "Are there any other Śākyamuni monks?"

source_sentence: 報言：「更有。」
translation: He replied, "There's more."

source_sentence: 門人即便入白王曰：「大王！
translation: The disciple then went in and said to the king, "Great king!

source_sentence: 釋迦苾芻來在門外，得令入不？」
translation: Would you let the Śākyamuni enter if he were outside the gate?"

source_sentence: 王言：「喚入！
translation: The king said, "Call and enter!

source_sentence: 我觀釋迦苾芻其狀如何？」
translation: How do I observe Śākyamuni's appearance?"

source_sentence: 門人引入既至王所，王識顏狀，問言：「鄔陀夷！
translation: When the disciple brought him to the king, he recognized his face and asked, "Udayin!

source_sentence: 汝今出家？」
translation: Are you leaving home now?"

source_sentence: 報言：「我已出家。」
translation: He replied, "I've left home."

source_sentence: 王便問曰：「一切義成太子亦作如是形狀？」
translation: The king then asked, "Did Prince Chos kyi Sung also take this shape?"

source_sentence: 答言：「大王！
translation: He replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 亦同此狀。」
translation: He was in the same condition."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王無始劫來恩愛情重，聞是語已即便悶絕投身躄地，以冷水灑良久乃穌，從地起已問鄔陀夷曰：「一切義成太子欲來此不？」
translation: After hearing these words, the king of Jīvaka, who had been deeply attached to him since time immemorial, was overcome with sorrow and threw himself to the ground.

source_sentence: 答言：「欲來。」
translation: He replied, "I want to come."

source_sentence: 「何時欲來？」
translation: "When do you want to come?"

source_sentence: 「過七日已方來至此。」
translation: "He'll come here only after seven days have passed."

source_sentence: 時王即便命諸臣曰：「一切義成太子過七日已欲歸故居，卿等應可修飾城隍莊嚴道路，宮中內人亦令灑掃，太子欲來。」
translation: The king then ordered his ministers, "Since the prince Ikṣvāku wants to return to his former home after seven days, you may decorate the city gods, adorn the roads, and clean the palace's interior with people who want the prince to come."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷言：「世尊不住王家及內宮裏。」
translation: Udayin said, "The Bhagavān doesn't stay at the king's house or in the palace."

source_sentence: 王曰：「何處居停？」
translation: The king said, "Where does he stay?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「或阿蘭若、或毘訶羅。」
translation: He answered, "Perhaps it's Araṇḍa or Vihāra."

source_sentence: 王告諸臣曰：「卿等往阿蘭若處屈路陀林，同逝多林造一住處，有十六大院、院六十房。」
translation: The king told the ministers, "Go to the forest of Kuludhā in Araṇjaya and make a dwelling in the same forest as Jeta's Grove, with 16 large courtyards and 60 rooms in the courtyard."

source_sentence: 是時諸臣奉王命已，遂往阿蘭若屈路陀林，同逝多林造十六大院、院有六十房。
translation: After the ministers obeyed the king's order, they went to the forest of Kuludhārā in Araṇjaya and built a dwelling in Jeta's Grove with 16 large courtyards and 60 rooms.

source_sentence: 然大王教令隨言即成，諸勝天人舉心事辦，相應定力意念皆就，於此城中街衢巷陌屏除諸穢，以栴檀香水而遍灑之，處處皆有殊妙香供，懸眾繒綵建立幢幡，布列香花誠可愛樂，猶如帝釋歡喜之園。
translation: However, as the king instructed, they did as they were told, and the work of the victorious gods and goddesses was accomplished with the power of concentration and attention. In the streets, lanes, and alleys of the city, they removed all defilements, sprinkled sandalwood scented water everywhere, made offerings of wonderful incense, hung numerous silken ribbons, erected banners, and placed a display of flowers and incense that was truly delightful, just like the joyous garden of Indra.

source_sentence: 時諸大眾各懷渴仰，瞻望世尊企想而住。
translation: The whole crowd then looked longingly at the Bhagavān and waited in anticipation.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊在逝多林，命大目連曰：「汝今宜往告諸苾芻：『如來欲向劫比羅城。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was in Jeta's Grove and ordered Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Now, why don't you go tell the monks, 'The Tathāgata wants to go to Kapila's city.

source_sentence: 若諸具壽情樂欲見父子相遇者，應持衣鉢。』」
translation: If there are sentient beings with long lives who wish to see their father and son meet, they should bring their robes and bowls.'"

source_sentence: 時大目連受佛教已，告諸苾芻曰：「諸具壽！
translation: After he had received the teaching, Mahāmaudgalyāyana addressed the monks, saying, 'Fellow monks!

source_sentence: 世尊欲向劫比羅城。
translation: The Bhagavān wants to go to Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 若諸具壽！
translation: What if all the sentient beings!

source_sentence: 情樂欲見父子相遇者，應持衣鉢隨從世尊。」
translation: Those who wish to see father and son meet should take their robes and bowls and follow the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻既承告已俱來從佛。
translation: After they had been told this, the monks all came to follow the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊自調伏故調伏圍繞，自寂靜故寂靜圍繞，解脫解脫圍繞，安隱安隱圍繞，善順善順圍繞，離欲離欲圍繞，阿羅漢阿羅漢圍繞，端嚴端嚴圍繞，如栴檀林栴檀圍繞，猶如象王象子圍繞，如師子王師子圍繞，如大牛王諸牛圍繞，猶如鵝王諸鵝圍繞，如妙翅王妙翅鳥圍繞，如波羅門學徒圍繞，猶如大醫病者圍繞，如大軍將兵眾圍繞，猶如導師行旅圍繞，猶如商主商客圍繞，如大長者人眾圍繞，如諸國王大臣圍繞，猶如明月眾星圍繞，猶如日輪千光圍繞，如持國天王乾闥婆圍繞，如增長天王鳩槃荼圍繞，如醜目天王龍眾圍繞，如多聞天王藥叉眾圍繞，如淨妙王阿蘇羅眾圍繞，猶如帝釋三十三天圍繞，如梵天王梵眾圍繞，猶如大海湛然安住，猶如大雲靉靆垂布，猶如象王屏息狂醉，調伏諸根威儀寂靜，三十二相而為莊飾，八十種好以自嚴身，圓光一尋朗逾千日，安步而進如移寶山，十力、四無畏、大悲、三念住，無量功德皆悉圓滿。
translation: 爾時世尊自調伏故調伏圍繞，自寂靜故寂靜圍繞，解脫解脫圍繞，安隱安隱圍繞，善順善順圍繞，離欲離欲圍繞，阿羅漢阿羅漢圍繞，端嚴端嚴圍繞，如栴檀林栴檀圍繞，猶如象王象子圍繞，如師子王師子圍繞，如大牛王諸牛圍繞，猶如鵝王諸鵝圍繞，如妙翅王妙翅鳥圍繞，如波羅門學徒圍繞，猶如大醫病者圍繞，如大軍將兵眾圍繞，猶如導師行旅圍繞，猶如商主商客圍繞，如大長者人眾圍繞，如諸國王大臣圍繞，猶如明月眾星圍繞，猶如日輪千光圍繞，如持國天王乾闥婆圍繞，如增長天王鳩槃荼圍繞，如醜目天王龍眾圍繞，如多聞天王藥叉眾圍繞，如淨妙王阿蘇羅眾圍繞，猶如帝釋三十三天圍繞，如梵天王梵眾圍繞，猶如大海湛然安住，猶如大雲靉靆垂布，猶如象王屏息狂醉，調伏諸根威儀寂靜，三十二相而為莊飾，八十種好以自嚴身，圓光一尋朗逾千日，安步而進如移寶山，十力、四無畏、大悲、三念住，無量功德皆悉圓滿。

source_sentence: 諸大聲聞：尊者阿眘若憍陳如、尊者高勝、尊者婆瑟波、尊者大名、尊者無滅、尊者舍利子、尊者大目連、尊者迦攝波、尊者名稱、尊者圓滿等，諸大聲聞及餘人眾往劫比羅，漸次而行至盧呬多河。
translation: The great śrāvakas, Venerable Acala Kauṇḍinya, Venerable Vātsīpa, Venerable Mahānāman, Venerable Merciless, Venerable Śāriputra, Venerable Mahāmucilin, Venerable Kāśyapa, Venerable Name, and Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaniputra, the great śrāvakas and the rest of the crowd went to Kapilavastu and gradually made their way to the Rājita River.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻，或有洗濯手足、或嚼齒木、或濾淨水、或時澡浴。
translation: Some of those monks washed their hands and feet, chewed wood, filtered pure water, or bathed at times.

source_sentence: 是時劫比羅城所有人眾，聞一切義成太子今欲來至，皆大歡喜競共奔走往屈路陀林。
translation: When the whole crowd in Kapilavastu heard that Prince Prabhākaramitra was about to arrive, they all rejoiced and ran together to the forest of Kuludhārā.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王於寬廣處敷設床座以待太子，是時乃有無量百千大眾雲集，或有先世善根共相警覺，或有情生喜樂作如是念：「為父禮子？
translation: When King Jīvaka spread out a seat in a wide place to await the prince, an incalculable hundred thousand people gathered, some with good roots from previous lives, and some sentient beings rejoiced and thought, "Is this the father's way of worshipping the son?

source_sentence: 為子拜父耶？」
translation: Is it for the son to worship his father?"

source_sentence: 時佛世尊便作是念：「我若足步入城中者，諸釋迦子各起慢情，共生不信作如是議：『一切義成太子大有所失，昔時去日百千天眾隨從空中，於劫比羅城圍繞而去。
translation: The Bhagavān then had this thought, "If I were to enter the city with my feet, the Śākyas would each become proud and have disbelief in common, saying, 'The prince All Souls has failed greatly, and on the day he left, a hundred thousand gods followed him into the air, surrounded him in Kapilavastu.

source_sentence: 今者獲得無上妙智，更乃足步而還。』
translation: Now, having attained unsurpassed marvelous knowledge, he has even taken a step back.'

source_sentence: 欲令諸人息輕慢心故，我今應以神變入劫比羅城。」
translation: Because I want to make people stop being arrogant, I should now enter Kapilavastu with a miraculous transformation."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊隨心所念入三摩地，既入定已於座不現，共諸苾芻踊在虛空，猶如滿月共相圍繞，亦如鵝王舒翼而住，行住坐臥四威儀中廣現神變。
translation: After he had calmed down and entered samādhi, the Bhagavān withdrew from his seat and was joined by a group of monks who were standing in the sky like a full moon surrounded by one another, like a king goose stretching its wings, and who performed miraculous feats while walking, standing, sitting, and lying down in four manners.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊先於東方入火光定，現種種焰青黃赤白紅頗胝色，或現變神通身上出水身下出火，身上出火身下出水。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān first entered the concentration of firelight in the east, where he showed various flames of blue, yellow, red, white, and red-bright colors, or he showed miraculous powers that produced water from his body, fire from beneath his body, and water from beneath his body.

source_sentence: 如東方既然，南西北方亦復如是。
translation: As it was in the east, it's likewise in the south, west, and north.

source_sentence: 次攝神通，於虛空中高七多羅樹。
translation: Next, he recites his superknowledge to raise seven tāla trees in the sky.

source_sentence: 時諸苾芻但高六樹，世尊高六、苾芻高五，佛五眾四，佛四眾三，佛三眾二，佛二眾一。
translation: The monks then simply raised six trees, the Bhagavān raised six, the monks raised five, the Buddha raised five crowds of four, the Buddha raised four crowds of three, the Buddha raised three crowds of two, and the Buddha raised two crowds of one.

source_sentence: 佛一眾與六人等，佛六眾五，佛五眾四，佛四眾三，佛三眾二，佛二眾一，佛一眾便居地。
translation: The Buddha's one group was equal to the six, the Buddha's six groups of five, the Buddha's five groups of four, the Buddha's four groups of three, the Buddha's three groups of two, the Buddha's two groups of one, and the Buddha's one group of one then resided on the ground.

source_sentence: 世尊去地高踰一人行空而去，并與無量百千俱胝人天大眾圍繞而去，至劫比羅城。
translation: The Bhagavān left the ground, traveled through the air more than a man, and left surrounded by a great multitude of measureless hundreds of thousands of koṭīs and gods and reached the city of Kapila.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王既見佛已，頭面禮足說伽他曰：「佛初生時大地動，　　贍部樹影不離身；　今是第三禮圓智，　　降伏魔怨成正覺。」
translation: After he saw the Buddha, the Vimalakīrti king bowed his head and feet and said to him, "When the Buddha was first born, the earth moved, and the shadow of the almsbowl tree didn't part from his body. Now, this is the third act of worship and perfect wisdom, which subdues Māra's enemies and makes him perfectly enlightened."

source_sentence: 時諸釋迦及餘大眾，見淨飯王禮佛足已，情生不忍共相唱言：「云何尊父禮子之足？」
translation: When the Śākyas and the rest of the crowd saw King Jōtoku bowing his head to the Buddha's feet, their feelings became intolerant as they all called out, "How does a venerable father bow to the feet of his son?"

source_sentence: 時淨飯王告諸釋子曰：「汝等不應作如是語，當時菩薩初生之日大地振動，放大光明普照世界，其色晃曜過於三十三天，於世界中間黑闇之處，日月威光之所不及。
translation: King Jīvaka then addressed the Śākyamuni sons, "You shouldn't say that. On the day the bodhisattva first arises, the earth shakes and magnifies its light to shine universally in the world, and its color shines brighter than that of the Trāyastriṃśa Heaven, and there's a place in the middle of the world that's so dark that the sun and moon's mighty light doesn't reach it.

source_sentence: 當爾之時並蒙光曜，彼處所有舊住有情蒙光曜已互得相見，共作是語：『仁等有情亦居此處。』
translation: At the time, they were both illuminated, and all the sentient beings who had lived there previously were able to see each other after being illuminated, and they all said, 'You sentient beings also live here.'

source_sentence: 爾時我見希有事已便禮佛足。
translation: After seeing something rare, I then saluted the Buddha's feet.

source_sentence: 又復菩薩曾往田中觀諸產業，於贍部樹影結跏而坐，遠離欲界惡不善法，有尋有伺得喜樂定，入初靜慮。
translation: Again, the bodhisattva had gone out to the fields and observed the [living] beings, sitting cross-legged in the shadow of the almsbowl tree, secluded from the bad and unskillful things of the desire realm, discursive and discursive, and attained a joyful concentration and entered the first concentration.

source_sentence: 日已過午，其餘諸樹影悉東垂，唯贍部樹影而獨不移蔭菩薩身。
translation: When the sun was past noon, the shadows of the other trees all hung to the east, except for the shadow of the Jambū tree, which didn't move to shade the bodhisattva's body.

source_sentence: 爾時我見希有事已復禮佛足。
translation: After I saw something rare, I then paid homage to the Buddha's feet.

source_sentence: 此是第三禮世尊足。」
translation: This is the third time I saluted the Bhagavān's feet."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊，於苾芻眾中及諸大眾就座而坐。
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was sitting in the congregation of monks and the general public.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王復禮佛足一面而坐，此是第四禮世尊足。
translation: The Śuddhodana King then paid homage to the Buddha's feet and sat down at one side, which was the fourth time he paid homage to the Bhagavān's feet.

source_sentence: 時諸釋迦於屈路陀林中殊妙之處，敷設勝座并上供養，以待世尊及苾芻眾。
translation: The Śākyas then spread out their excellent seats and made offerings to the Bhagavān and the crowd of monks in a marvelous place in the Kuludhāna forest.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊詣彼林所，於大眾中就座而坐。
translation: The Bhagavān then went to that forest and took his seat among the crowd.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王即以種種盡世微妙殊勝供養供佛僧已，時淨飯王、白飯王、斛飯王、甘露飯王，及餘百千諸來大眾，禮佛足已在一面坐，或有諸人但為合掌，復有諸人遙望世尊默然而坐。
translation: After King Jōtō had made all kinds of offerings to the Buddha and Saṃgha, King Jōtō, King Prabhūtaratna, King Dundubhū, King Amṛta, and a hundred thousand other people from the community bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet and sat down at one side, while some simply folded their palms and others looked away from the Bhagavān and sat silently.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王即以伽他而問佛曰：「佛昔在王宮，　　出乘象馬輿；　云何以雙足，　　遊於棘刺中？」
translation: Then, King Jīvaka asked the Buddha with a question, "Once, when the Buddha was in the palace, he rode out on an elephant and horseback; why did he wander among the thorns with his two feet?"

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「我以神足通，　　自在乘空去，　周行大地盡，　　煩惱刺無傷。」
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "With supernormal powers, I freely ride off into the sky, travel around the whole earth, and am unscathed by the thorns of affliction."

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「昔衣上妙服，　　容色多光彩；　今著麁弊衣，　　如何得堪忍？」
translation: The king then asked, "In the past, I wore fine clothing with a lot of radiance, but now I'm wearing crude clothing, how can I tolerate it?"

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「慚愧為上服，　　披著甚端嚴，　見者起歡心，　　寂靜居林野。」
translation: The Bhagavān replied, "Being ashamed is the best garment, and it's worn with great dignity. Those who see it are delighted, and they quietly reside in the forest and wilderness."

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「昔飡香稻飯，　　盛以勝金盤，　乞匃噉麁踈，　　云何得充濟？」
translation: The king then asked, "How could a monk who once ate fragrant rice filled with a dish of superior gold and begged for food and gnawed on it be able to make ends meet?"

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「我飡微妙法，　　味與定相應；　蠲除飲食貪，　　愍物故哀受。」
translation: The Bhagavān replied, "I eat a delicious, subtle meal that's tasty and consistent with concentration; I remove craving for food and drink and accept it with pity for [living] beings."

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「昔昇妙樓殿，　　隨時以自安；　比在山林中，　　云何不驚怖？」
translation: The king then asked, "In the past, I ascended to a marvelous mansion and made myself comfortable at appropriate times; why wasn't I frightened when I was in the mountains and forests?"

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「我斷怖根本，　　煩惱悉蠲除；　雖處林野中，　　永絕諸憂懼。」
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "I have ended the root of fear and all my afflictions have been removed; even though I'm in a forest or wilderness, I'm free of sorrow and fear."

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「昔在王宮內，　　沐浴以香湯；　比居林野中，　　牟尼以何浴？」
translation: The king then asked, "In the past, we bathed in fragrant baths in the king's palace; what did the Muni bathe in, compared to living in the forest and wilderness?"

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「法池福德津，　　清淨人所歎，　智者於中浴，　　去垢不霑身。」
translation: The Bhagavān reported, "The Dharma pool is a lake of merit that's pure and admired by people, and a wise person bathes in it, removing dirt and not covering his body."

source_sentence: 王復問曰：「昔日在王宮，　　金瓶灌水浴，　比在江池處，　　何器以澆身？」
translation: The king then asked, "In the past, we were in the palace, bathing in water from a golden vase. What vessel would we use to wash ourselves in this place, compared to a river pool?"

source_sentence: 世尊報曰：「我浴淨戒水，　　灌以妙法器，　智者共欽讚，　　能淨身心垢。」
translation: The Bhagavān answered, "I bathed them in pure precepts water and filled them with the wonderful Dharma vessel, which is praised by wise men as being able to cleanse the defilements of body and mind."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊以妙伽他答淨飯王已，次觀大眾意樂隨眠界性差別，稱彼根機而為說法。
translation: After the Bhagavān answered the pure rice king with the wonderful kāṭā, he then observed the masses' intentions and dispositions as they differed according to the nature of the sleeping realm and taught the Dharma according to their faculties and abilities.

source_sentence: 其聽法者，所謂白飯王、斛飯王、甘露飯王，及餘百千諸來大眾，同聞妙法得預流果、或得一來果、或得不還果、或有出家斷諸煩惱證阿羅漢果、或發獨覺菩提之心、或有發起無上菩提之心，自餘諸眾皆令歸依三寶住正信中。
translation: Those who heard the teaching, the White Rice King, the Dried Rice King, the Nectarine Rice King, and the hundreds of thousands of other people who came, all heard the wonderful teaching together and attained the fruit of pre-flow, the fruit of once-returning, the fruit of non-returning, some left home, cut off the afflictions, realized the fruit of the arhat, some developed the mind of solitary awakening and enlightenment, and some developed the mind of unsurpassed enlightenment, and the rest of the crowd all made to rely on the Three Treasures and abide in right faith.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王由極歡喜故未得見諦，淨飯王及諸大眾禮佛足已恭敬而去。
translation: Being overjoyed, King Jōtan hadn't yet seen the truth, so King Jōtan and the others saluted the Buddha's feet, paid their respects, and departed.

source_sentence: 其淨飯王便於夜中作如是念：「唯我一子有此威德餘無及者。」
translation: Then, in the middle of the night, King Jōtan thought, "Only one of my sons has this authority, and there's no one else like him."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知淨飯王心之所念，欲令降伏家宗慢故，至天曉已便命大目連曰：「汝當觀察愍念父王。」
translation: Knowing what was on the mind of King Jōtan and wanting to subdue the conceit of his school, the Bhagavān then ordered Mahāmaudgalyāyana after sunrise, "Observe and take pity on your father, King."

source_sentence: 目連白佛言：「唯然。
translation: Maudgalyāyana said to the Buddha, "Yes, sir.

source_sentence: 世尊！」
translation: Bhagavān!"

source_sentence: 即便執持衣鉢詣淨飯王所。
translation: He then took his robe and bowl and went to King Śuddhodana.

source_sentence: 時王既見目連來至，便唱善來命之就座。
translation: When the king saw Maudgalyāyana arrive, he called out to him, "Well come," and ordered him to take his seat.

source_sentence: 是時目連即如所念入三摩地，既入定已隱身於座踊現空中。
translation: Mucilin then entered samādhi just as he had thought, and after he had entered his concentration, he withdrew into his seat and appeared in the air.

source_sentence: 時大目連先於東方入火光定，現種種焰青黃赤白紅色頗胝迦色，或變神通身上出水身下出火，身上出火身下出水。
translation: At the time, Mahāmaudgalyāyana first entered the concentration of firelight in the east, which produces a variety of flames that are blue, yellow, red, white, and red in color, or it miraculously changes its powers to produce water from its body, fire from its bottom, and water from its bottom.

source_sentence: 如東方既然，南西北方亦復如是。
translation: Now that it's in the east, it's likewise in the south, west, and north.

source_sentence: 次攝神通現於本座。
translation: Next, he gathered his superknowledge and showed it to his seat.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王白大目連曰：「世尊弟子更有如是大威德類如尊者不？」
translation: King Jīvaka then said to Mahāmaudgalyāyana, "Is there another disciple of the Bhagavān who has such great authority and virtue as the Bhagavān?"

source_sentence: 時大目連即為父王說伽他曰：「牟尼聖弟子，　　皆有大威德，　三明及六通，　　無不具足者。」
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana then addressed the king's father, saying, "The noble disciples of Muni all possess great authority, and there's nothing that the three sciences and six supernormal powers don't fulfill."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王便作是念：「非唯我子有大威德，於餘亦有如是苾芻具大神力。」
translation: The king of Jīvaka then had this thought, "My son isn't the only one with great authority; there are other such monks who possess great powers."

source_sentence: 前起慢心即便除斷。
translation: The previously arisen conceit was then removed.

source_sentence: 是時淨飯王復作是念：「今者世尊唯人供養，不見諸天。」
translation: Then, King Jīvaka again thought, "Now, the Bhagavān is worshipped by humans alone, but he doesn't see the gods."

source_sentence: 時大目連知王念已，便白王曰：「大王！
translation: Knowing that the king was thinking this, Mahāmaudgalyāyana then said to the king, "Great king!

source_sentence: 我今還欲往世尊所。」
translation: Now, I still want to go to the Bhagavān."

source_sentence: 白言：「隨意。」
translation: He said, "As you wish."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王亦詣佛所。
translation: King Jīvaka then also went to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊知父王念，即於屈路陀林悉皆化作蘇頗胝迦。
translation: Knowing what his father was thinking, the Bhagavān then transformed all of them into sphāṭikas in the forest of Kuludhā.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王欲東門入，門人報曰：「大王勿入。」
translation: When King Jōtan wanted to enter through the east gate, the gatekeeper reported, "Don't enter, Great King!"

source_sentence: 王曰：「何意？」
translation: The king said, "What do you mean?"

source_sentence: 門人報曰：「佛今純為諸天說法。」
translation: The disciple reported, "Now, the Buddha simply teaches the Dharma for the gods."

source_sentence: 王問門人曰：「賢首！
translation: The king asked the disciple, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 汝是何人？」
translation: Who are you?"

source_sentence: 門人答曰：「大王！
translation: The disciples replied, "Great king!

source_sentence: 我是東方持國天王。」
translation: I am the king of the gods who hold the country in the east."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王便往南門欲見世尊，門人白言：「大王勿入。」
translation: King Jōtan then went to the south gate to see the Bhagavān, but the gatekeeper said, "Don't enter, Great King."

source_sentence: 王問：「何意？」
translation: The king asked, "What do you mean?"

source_sentence: 門人報曰：「佛今純為諸天說法。」
translation: The disciple reported, "Now, the Buddha simply teaches the Dharma for the gods."

source_sentence: 王問門人曰：「賢首！
translation: The king asked the disciple, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 汝是何人？」
translation: Who are you?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「我是南方增長天王。」
translation: He replied, "I'm the southern Virūḍhaka king."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王便往西門欲見世尊，門人白言：「大王勿入。」
translation: The king of Jīvaka then went to the west gate to see the Bhagavān, but the gatekeeper said, "Don't enter, great king."

source_sentence: 王問：「何意？」
translation: The king asked, "What do you mean?"

source_sentence: 門人報曰：「佛今純為諸天說法。」
translation: The disciple reported, "Now, the Buddha simply teaches the Dharma for the gods."

source_sentence: 王問門人曰：「賢首！
translation: The king asked the disciple, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 汝是何人？」
translation: Who are you?"

source_sentence: 門人答曰：「我是西方醜目天王。」
translation: The gatekeeper replied, "I'm Ugly-Eyed King of the West."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王便往北門欲見世尊，門人白言：「大王勿入。」
translation: When King Jōtan went to the northern gate to see the Bhagavān, the gatekeeper said, "Don't enter, Great King."

source_sentence: 王問：「何意？」
translation: The king asked, "What do you mean?"

source_sentence: 門人報曰：「佛今純為諸天說法。」
translation: The disciple reported, "Now, the Buddha simply teaches the Dharma for the gods."

source_sentence: 王問門人曰：「賢首！
translation: The king asked the disciple, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 汝是何人？」
translation: Who are you?"

source_sentence: 門人答曰：「我是北方多聞天王。」
translation: The disciple answered, "I'm the well-versed heavenly king of the north."

source_sentence: 爾時世尊便以神力加被淨飯王，令於門外見佛世尊與諸天眾說微妙法。
translation: The Bhagavān then bestowed miraculous powers on King Jōtoku and caused him to see the Bhagavān outside the gate, speaking the subtle Dharma with the gods.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王見是事已便作斯念：「今佛世尊非唯人眾之所供養，亦為諸天而來親奉。」
translation: After seeing this, King Jōtoku then had this thought, "Now, the Bhagavān isn't just someone people worship, he's also someone the gods serve."

source_sentence: 令淨飯王慢心息已便攝神變。
translation: After he calmed King Jōtan's conceit, he then undertook a miraculous transformation.

source_sentence: 時大目連引淨飯王入見世尊，既至佛所禮佛足已在一面坐。
translation: Mahāmaudgalyāyana then led King Jīvaka into the room to see the Bhagavān, and after he reached the Buddha and bowed his feet, he sat down at one side.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊隨淨飯王及餘諸眾意樂隨眠界性差別，隨其根機而為說法，令淨飯王以智金剛杵摧破二十身見高山得預流果。
translation: The Bhagavān then followed the wishes of King Jōtoku and the others, followed the differences in the nature of the sleeping realm and explained the teaching according to their faculties and abilities, and caused King Jōtoku to use the vajra of wisdom to destroy twenty bodies and see the high mountains to attain the fruit of abortion.

source_sentence: 既證果已白佛言：「世尊！
translation: Once he had realized the fruit, he said to the Buddha, "Bhagavān!

source_sentence: 我今所證非高祖所作，亦非父母所作，非王非天非沙門婆羅門，非諸宗親之所能作。
translation: What I've realized now wasn't done by my great grandfather, wasn't done by my parents, wasn't done by kings or gods or ascetics, and wasn't something that could be done by clansmen.

source_sentence: 我依世尊善知識故方獲斯事，於捺落迦、傍生、餓鬼三惡道中，拔濟令出安置人天，能盡未來生死邊際，乾竭血淚巨海，越度白骨大山，無始已來曾所積集，身見窟宅今並除棄證斯妙果。
translation: It's because of the Bhagavān's good teacher that I've attained this result, that I've been rescued from the three evil destinies of naraka, unenlightened beings, and hungry ghosts and placed among humans and gods, that I've been able to end the limits of future birth and death, dry up the huge ocean of blood and tears, cross the great mountain of white bones, and accumulate since beginningless time, and now I've removed the cave of my body and realized this wonderful result.

source_sentence: 大德！
translation: Great Teacher!

source_sentence: 於生死流我今得出，我今歸依佛法僧寶為鄔波索迦。
translation: Now, I've escaped from the stream of birth-and-death, and I now rely on the treasures of the Buddha, Dharma, and Saṃgha as upāsaka.

source_sentence: 唯願世尊慈悲鑒察，我從今日乃至盡形，不斷有情命乃至不飲諸酒，頂受世尊所制學處。」
translation: May the Bhagavān have the compassion to examine me, so that from this day until the end of my life, I won't stop living as a sentient being or drink alcohol, and I'll accept the Bhagavān's prescribed training position."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王禮佛而去，便詣白飯王所報言：「太子可受王位。」
translation: King Jōtan then paid homage to the Buddha and departed, going to King Śuddhodana to report, "The crown prince may accept the throne."

source_sentence: 彼便報曰：「有何意耶？」
translation: He then replied, "What do you think?"

source_sentence: 王曰：「我今見諦不能為王。」
translation: The king said, "Now, I see that the truth doesn't make me king."

source_sentence: 問言：「何日？」
translation: He asked, "When will that be?"

source_sentence: 報言：「今日。」
translation: They replied, "Today!"

source_sentence: 彼便報曰：「我於世尊初來之日，即於彼時我得見諦。」
translation: They then reported, "On the day the Bhagavān first came, that's when I attained views of the truth."

source_sentence: 次往斛飯王，後往甘露飯王所，冀稱王位，彼悉自云：「我已見諦。」
translation: He then went to King Branham and then to King Amṛta, hoping to claim the king's position, and they all said to themselves, "I've seen the truth."

source_sentence: 淨飯王曰：「若如是者我今欲灌誰頂令受王位？」
translation: King Nandana said, "If that's the case, who would I like to consecrate to the throne now?"

source_sentence: 彼便報曰：「釋迦童子名曰賢善！
translation: He then reported, "The boy Śākyamuni is called 'Good!'

source_sentence: 可稱王位。」
translation: He may be called to the position of king."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王即便灌頂，以其王位授與賢善。
translation: King Jōtan then consecrated his head and gave his throne to Goodness.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊及苾芻僧眾，於日日中入王宮內受其供養。
translation: The Bhagavān and a retinue of monks and nuns then entered the king's palace every day to accept his offerings.

source_sentence: 時淨飯王作如是念：「今佛弟子外道千人，心雖端正身非嚴好，由昔苦身形容瘦悴。
translation: The Bhagavān then had this thought, "Now, there are a thousand non-Buddhist disciples of the Buddha who are correct in mind but whose bodies aren't dignified and whose appearance was thin and emaciated because of their past suffering.

source_sentence: 云何得令世尊門徒，容儀可愛覩相生善？
translation: How could they cause the Bhagavān's disciples to have pleasing appearances and good looks?

source_sentence: 若令釋種陪隨世尊，方是端嚴，人共尊重。」
translation: If the Śākyamuni lineage were to accompany the Bhagavān, that would be dignified and well-respected by people."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王集諸釋種而告之曰：「諸君當知，一切義成太子若不出家者當何所作？」
translation: The king of Jīvaka then gathered the Śākyamuni lineage and told them, "Gentlemen, you should know, 'What would Prince Yisheng do if he didn't leave home?'"

source_sentence: 彼皆報曰：「作轉輪王。」
translation: They all replied, "They'll become wheel-turning kings."

source_sentence: 又問曰：「君等作何？」
translation: They also asked, "What will you do?"

source_sentence: 報言：「我等稱臣皆為從者。」
translation: They replied, "We're all called ministers, and we all follow him."

source_sentence: 王復告曰：「今一切義成太子證甘露法，亦令有情同飡斯味。
translation: The king then told them, "Now, Prince Shisheng has realized the nectar-like dharma, and he's causing sentient beings to partake of its flavor.

source_sentence: 仁等何因不為隨從？」
translation: Why don't you follow him?"

source_sentence: 彼皆報曰：「我今出家。」
translation: They all reported, "Now, I've left home."

source_sentence: 王曰：「各隨汝意。」
translation: The king said, "Each one will do as you like."

source_sentence: 諸釋子曰：「為全家並去？
translation: The Śākyas said, "Why did the whole family leave together?

source_sentence: 為當家別一人？」
translation: For the sake of the other person in the household?"

source_sentence: 王曰：「家別一人。」
translation: The king said, "Let's distinguish one person from another in the family."

source_sentence: 時淨飯王即便槌鍾，宣令普告諸釋種中，家別一人出家奉佛，若不肯者必招咎責。
translation: Then, King Jōtan even struck a bell and ordered that one of the Śākyamuni lineage be told to leave home and serve the Buddha, or else he would be blamed if he refused.

source_sentence: 即於是時釋種之中，賢善、無滅等五百釋子悉皆出家。
translation: At that point, five hundred Śākyamuni sons of the Śākyamuni lineage, including Bhadrika and Mūlasarvâstivāda, all left home.

source_sentence: 如世尊說，若捨貴族而出家者多獲利養。
translation: As the Bhagavān explained, if someone renounces their noble family and leaves home, they'll often reap benefits.

source_sentence: 時五百釋子苾芻極招利養，爾時世尊便作是念：「此諸釋子本為解脫而求出家，今捨少欲耽著財利。」
translation: When those five hundred Śākyamuni monks were actively seeking profit, the Bhagavān then had this thought, "These Śākyamuni monks originally sought to leave home for the sake of their liberation, but now they've given up their few desires and become addicted to wealth and profit."

source_sentence: 世尊欲令絕利養故，即便旋往室羅伐城，在逝多林如昔安住。
translation: Desiring to cut off profit, the Bhagavān then went on to Śrāvastī and stayed at Jeta's Grove as before.

source_sentence: 時具壽鄔陀夷於日初分執持衣鉢，入室羅伐城次第乞食，遂至故二笈多之宅在門而立。
translation: At the beginning of the day, Kauśāmbī took his robe and bowl and went into Śrāvastī to solicit alms in order.

source_sentence: 是時笈多遙見鄔陀夷來，瞻其顏狀知是故二，即便以手槌胸而告之曰：「鄔陀夷！
translation: When the Gupta saw Udayin coming from a distance, he looked at his face and knew that he was the late second Gupta, so he struck him on the chest with his hand and told him, "Udayin!

source_sentence: 仁今何意棄我出家？」
translation: Why do you now renounce me as a monk?"

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「賢首！
translation: Udayin said, "Bhadraśri!

source_sentence: 如我世尊為菩薩時，便捨寶女耶輸陀羅(持稱亦云具稱)、瞿比迦(密語也)、密伽闍(鹿子也)等六萬婇女而為出俗，誰能共汝塵垢之面而沈溺耶？」
translation: Just as when the Bhagavān was a bodhisattva, he abandoned 60,000 Ṛṣṭhila women, including the precious daughter Yaśodhar, Gopī, and Mikāja, to leave the world, who would share your defiled face and become submerged?"

source_sentence: 笈多報言：「鄔陀夷！
translation: Gṛdhrakūṭa replied, "Udayin!

source_sentence: 若如是者，我亦出家。」
translation: If that's the case, I'll leave home, too."

source_sentence: 答曰：「善哉！」
translation: They replied, "Good!"

source_sentence: 笈多報言：「我今收斂家業尋當出家。」
translation: Gautama replied, "Now, I've gathered up my family business and will leave home."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「宜疾勿遲。」
translation: Udayin said, "It's better to hurry than to delay."

source_sentence: 遂捨而去。
translation: He then abandoned them and departed.

source_sentence: 然鄔陀夷於時時中數來看問，告笈多曰：「汝未出家。」
translation: Nevertheless, Udāyin came to see him several times during that time and told Gṛdāra, "You haven't left home yet."

source_sentence: 彼便報曰：「我之家業尚未收斂。」
translation: He then replied, "I haven't yet gathered the karma of my family."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「要待憍薩羅國煨燼之後，汝之家業方可了耶？」
translation: Udayin said, "Will your family's work be finished only after the burning of the country of Kośala?"

source_sentence: 笈多報言：「今即收斂明當出家。」
translation: The Gupta replied, "Now, I'll take this as an austerity measure, and I'll leave home."

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷便作是念：「我於今時由昔俗累，尚被黑鉢同梵行者所輕，況復令彼出家更招譏議，云六眾苾芻度苾芻尼。」
translation: Udayinī then thought, "Now, I've been burdened by conventionality in the past and have still been despised by those who practice the same religion as the black bowl, so why would I allow them to leave home and invite further criticism, saying that the six groups of monks and nuns have been saved by the monks and nuns?"

source_sentence: 便生追悔。
translation: They then repented.

source_sentence: 至天曉已，執持衣鉢往王舍城，既至彼已安居坐夏。
translation: When sunrise arrived, he took his robe and bowl and went to Rājagṛha, where he settled down for the summer retreat.

source_sentence: 是時笈多付家業已，便於他日往逝多林，問諸苾芻曰：「彼向何處？」
translation: After paying his dues, Gṛdhrakūṭa then went to Jeta's Grove on another day and asked the monks, "Where is he headed?"

source_sentence: 苾芻問曰：「彼者是誰？」
translation: The monk asked, "Who is he?"

source_sentence: 報言：「聖者鄔陀夷！」
translation: He replied, "Sage Udayin!"

source_sentence: 諸苾芻報曰：「彼以遠趣王舍大城。」
translation: The monks replied, "They've gone far away to the great city of Rājagṛha."

source_sentence: 彼既聞已即便啼泣。
translation: After hearing this, they even wept.

source_sentence: 苾芻問言：「笈多！
translation: The monks asked, "Gupta!

source_sentence: 何意啼泣？」
translation: What do you mean by weeping?"

source_sentence: 報言：「聖者鄔陀夷！
translation: He replied, "Sage Udayin!

source_sentence: 令我棄俗許與出家，我既付囑家產，彼便遠捨而去。
translation: I was told to leave my secular home and accept leaving home, but after I gave them my family's property, they left far away.

source_sentence: 我今不居俗舍復非出家，寧不憂惱？」
translation: Now, since I don't live in a secular home and am not a renunciant, wouldn't I be distressed?"

source_sentence: 有人報曰：「為剃刀故彼向王城，欲取新刀剃汝新髮。」
translation: Someone reported, "That man went to the king's city to get a new razor to shave your new hair."

source_sentence: 于時苾芻尼眾為請教授來逝多林，見彼笈多行啼憂悒，問言：「笈多！
translation: A group of nuns and monks who had been invited to teach the monks came to Jeta's Grove and saw Gṛdhrakūṭa's troubled behavior.

source_sentence: 何意啼泣？」
translation: What do you mean by weeping?"

source_sentence: 笈多具以前事告苾芻尼，諸尼報曰：「汝誠無識，豈有苾芻度苾芻尼耶？
translation: When the Gautama addressed the bhikṣuṇīs about the previous events, the nuns replied, "You really don't have any consciousness, do you think there are bhikṣuṇīs who have saved the bhikṣuṇīs?

source_sentence: 還令尼眾度汝出家，可隨我來，至大世主喬答彌處度汝出家。」
translation: If you want the nuns to release you from your home, come with me to Gautamī, the Mahādeva, and release you from your home."

source_sentence: 時諸尼眾便將笈多至大世主處，白言：「聖者！
translation: The nuns then led Gautama to the Mahādeva and said, "Sage!

source_sentence: 此之笈多情願出家。」
translation: This is Gupta's wish to leave home."

source_sentence: 時大世主即與出家。
translation: The Mahākauṣṭhila then renounced the house.

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷在王舍城作如是念：「我為護惜諸黑鉢者故，不與笈多出家，我多喪失腰絛雜物資身之具。
translation: Udayinī then had this thought in Rājagṛha: "Because I want to protect those who treasure black bowls, I won't give Gṛdhrakūṭa permission to leave home, and I'll lose my waistband and sundries, as well as my personal belongings.

source_sentence: 若餘黑鉢度笈多出家者，乃至暫欲見我亦無由得。」
translation: If the other black pāramitās were to leave home with Gṛdhrakūṭa, there's no way they could even see me for a moment."

source_sentence: 雖及安居情常不樂。
translation: Even though he lives in peace, his feelings are always unhappy.

source_sentence: 時有摩訶羅苾芻，從室羅伐城夏安居已來至王城。
translation: A monk named Mahārāja had arrived in the king's city after his summer retreat from Śrāvastī.

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷於竹林精舍外近大道邊瞻望而住，遂遙見彼老苾芻來，髮若荻花眉長下覆，傴肩垂臂徐步而行。
translation: Udayinī was standing looking out near the road outside the Veḷuvana monastery when he saw from a distance that old monk coming, with hair like an oleander and eyebrows long and covered, walking slowly with his shoulders slumped and arms hanging down.

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷便作是念：「此之來者何上座耶？」
translation: Udayi then had this thought, "Which one of these is the senior monks who's come?"

source_sentence: 既相近已告言：「善來！
translation: Having come close, he said, "Good, come!

source_sentence: 善來上座！」
translation: Supremely virtuous comer!"

source_sentence: 老苾芻云：「敬禮阿遮利耶！
translation: The old bhikṣu said, "Greetings, ācārya!

source_sentence: 敬禮鄔波馱耶！」
translation: Homage to Upādhyāya!"

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷見無軌則不識二師，即知定是摩訶羅也，遂將入寺問言：「爾從何來？」
translation: When Udayinī saw that he didn't know the two masters from the guideless code, he knew that he must be Mahārāja.

source_sentence: 報言：「從室羅伐來。」
translation: He replied, "I've come from Śrāvastī."

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷便生是念：「若我先問笈多消息，聞者譏醜，我應次第而問。
translation: Udayinī then had this thought, "If I first asked Gupta about the news and the person who heard it criticized it, I should ask them in turn.

source_sentence: 汝摩訶羅既從彼來，得知世尊少病少惱起居輕利安樂行不？
translation: Since you Mahārāja came from there, have you learned that the Bhagavān is little sick and little afflicted, lives in ease and comfort, and conducts himself?

source_sentence: 在室羅伐為夏安居。」
translation: He's staying at Śrāvastī for the summer retreat."

source_sentence: 彼便報言：「世尊無病安樂在彼安居。」
translation: They then reported, "The Bhagavān is staying there in peace and happiness without illness."

source_sentence: 又問：「苾芻、苾芻尼、鄔波索迦、鄔波斯迦眾，並得無病安樂如常所居，於時時中奉覲世尊聽正法不？」
translation: They also asked, "Are there any monks, bhikṣuṇīs, upāsaka, or upāsikāsaka living in their usual homes without illness and in comfort, and at the same time are they paying respect to the Bhagavān and listening to the right teaching?"

source_sentence: 答言：「所問之人並得安隱，亦時時中來聞正法。」
translation: He answered, "Those who asked were both made comfortable and came to hear the right teaching from time to time."

source_sentence: 又問：「住位了教憍陳如、住位迦攝波、住位舍利子、大目連等諸餘尊宿，大世主喬答彌，及勝光王長者、仙授故舊、鹿母毘舍佉、善生夫人，悉得無病安樂住不？」
translation: He also asked, "Have the abiding Śakra Kauṇḍinya, the abiding Kāśyapa, the abiding Śāriputra, the Mahāmaudgalyāyana and other honored ones, the great lord Gautamī, the elder Śrīgarbha, the former Śrīgarbha, the mother of deer Vaiśākha, and the lady Śubhavyūha all attained peace and comfort without illness?"

source_sentence: 答言：「並安樂住。」
translation: He replied, "And abide comfortably."

source_sentence: 又問：「汝識長者婦笈多不？」
translation: Again, he asked, "Do you know Gṛdhrakūṭa, the elder woman?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我識。
translation: He replied, "I know her.

source_sentence: 彼是大德鄔陀夷昔日之妻。」
translation: She was once the wife of the great virtuous Udāyin."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「彼豈今時尚為長者之婦？」
translation: Udayin said, "Could it be that she's still the wife of an elder?"

source_sentence: 答曰：「已出家訖。」
translation: He answered, "I've left home."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷問曰：「誰與出家？」
translation: Udayin asked, "Who's left home with him?"

source_sentence: 報言：「是大世主。」
translation: He replied, "This is the great lord of the world!"

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷便作斯念：「既是出家或容再面。」
translation: Udayinī then had this thought, "Perhaps he's a renunciant and will allow himself to be re-faced."

source_sentence: 即便喚言：「摩訶羅且來濯足。」
translation: He then called out to them, "Mahārāja, come wash your feet!"

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷取彼衣鉢掛在極高象牙[木*戈]上，遂多與油令塗手足，報言：「今此房中有食有利，宜當安隱歡意而住。」
translation: Udayinī then took his robe and bowl, hung it on a very high ivory [log*go], and rubbed much oil on his hands and feet, saying, "Now that there's food in this room that's good for you, you should stay here in comfort and joy."

source_sentence: 彼便報言：「我不樂住。」
translation: He then reported, "I'm not happy to stay here."

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷便持鎖鑰而付與之，告言：「如世尊說：『苾芻不應空棄住處，捨之而去。』
translation: Udayinī then took the key to the lock and gave it to him, telling him, "Just as the Bhagavān said, 'A monk shouldn't abandon his dwelling place in vain and leave it behind.'

source_sentence: 摩訶羅！
translation: Mahāra!

source_sentence: 此是鎖鑰汝自當知。」
translation: This is the key to the lock. You should know it for yourself."

source_sentence: 說是語已，即便涉路漸至室羅伐城逝多林內，灑掃房宇以軟牛糞而塗拭已，便掩半扇偃臥床上，作歌詠聲而誦正法。
translation: After he spoke these words, he wandered off gradually to the Jetavana Grove in Śrāvastī, cleaned his room with soft cow dung, covered up half the door, lay down on his bed, and sang and chanted the right teaching.

source_sentence: 時有苾芻尼，為請教授而來至此，諸尼聞此諷誦之聲識其響韻，即便共往鄔陀夷所，問言：「大德往時走去，比何處來？」
translation: When some nuns who had requested instruction arrived, they heard the sound of this chanting and recognized its ringing, so they all went to Udayinī and asked, "Where did the great virtuous one come from when he was gone?"

source_sentence: 答言：「我前須往王舍城中。」
translation: He replied, "I must go to the city of Rājagṛha."

source_sentence: 尼問知已即便歸寺，告笈多曰：「汝今喜滿，阿遮利耶現已來至。」
translation: After he knew this, Nimi went back to the temple and told Bhagavān, "Now, you've fulfilled your joy, for ācārya has now arrived."

source_sentence: 笈多問曰：「若箇阿遮利耶？」
translation: The Gautama asked, "What about ācārya?"

source_sentence: 報言：「是鄔陀夷！」
translation: He replied, "Yes, Udayin!"

source_sentence: 笈多曰：「因何是我軌範之師？
translation: Gupta said, "Why is he my model teacher?

source_sentence: 我豈從彼而受學業？」
translation: Did I receive training from that?"

source_sentence: 諸尼報曰：「汝無識人，多有諸尼與大苾芻共相繫屬，汝今宜往問其安不？」
translation: The nuns replied, "You ignorant person, there are many nuns and great monks who are bound together, so why don't you go ask them if they're comfortable?"

source_sentence: 彼即具持屑香及油澡浴之物，往詣彼房扣門而喚。
translation: They then took a scrap of incense and oil to bathe their body, went to their room, buttoned the door, and called out.

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷問曰：「扣門者誰？」
translation: Udayin asked, "Who's that buttoning the door?"

source_sentence: 報曰：「我是笈多。」
translation: He replied, "I am Gupta."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「善來！
translation: Udayin said, "Good for you!

source_sentence: 善來！
translation: Come well!

source_sentence: 長者之婦，隨意當進。」
translation: An elderly woman should advance as she wishes."

source_sentence: 是時笈多入而告曰：「大德！
translation: Gupta then entered and said, "Mañjuśrī!

source_sentence: 我今豈是長者婦耶？
translation: Am I now an elderly woman?

source_sentence: 我已出家。」
translation: I've left home."

source_sentence: 問言：「誰復與汝而為出家？」
translation: He asked, "Who else will become a renunciant with you?"

source_sentence: 報言：「聖者！
translation: He replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 大世主與我出家。」
translation: The great world-lord has renounced the world with me."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「我有他事須向王城，汝復何緣急求離俗？」
translation: Udayin said, "I have other business to attend to in the king's city, so why do you urgently seek to leave the world?"

source_sentence: 彼便報曰：「豈非大德前作斯語：『汝當收斂家業，我度汝出家。』
translation: They then replied, "Did the great virtuous one not say this before, 'Suppose you were to put away your family business and I were to release you from the house.'

source_sentence: 我依斯教付囑家產，大德棄我遠向王城。
translation: I relied on that teaching to entrust my family's property, but the great virtuous one abandoned me and went far away to the king's city.

source_sentence: 若大世主不度我者，我誠非俗亦非出家。」
translation: If the great lord of the world doesn't grant me refuge, I'm really neither a layman nor a renunciant."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「我豈當時自貽重檐許言教汝，今且可坐為汝說法。」
translation: Udayin said, "Did I then become a critic and give you my word that I would teach you, and now I can sit down and explain the teaching to you?"

source_sentence: 禮已便坐端心聽法。
translation: After paying homage, he then sat down and listened intently to the teaching.

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷即為說法，說法之時即便追念昔時所有歡笑之事，問笈多曰：「汝憶往時在某園林天祠之處，飡噉如是美妙飯食。」
translation: Udayin was then teaching the Dharma, and as he was teaching, he even recalled all the joyous events of the past and asked Gautama, "Do you recall eating such wonderful food at a certain garden or forest or heavenly shrine in the past?"

source_sentence: 談話之時欲意便起，欲心既起情多錯亂。
translation: While they're talking, desire arises, and when desire arises, feelings are often distorted.

source_sentence: 凡智慧女人有五不共事表：知男女有欲盛心、無欲盛心。
translation: There are five things that ordinary wise women don't do together: they know when a man or woman has a mind full of desire and when they don't have a mind full of desire.

source_sentence: 笈多覺知鄔陀夷欲心熾盛，告言：「聖者！
translation: The Gautama realized that Udayinī's mind was ablaze with desire and told him, "Sage!

source_sentence: 我暫須出，事了還來。」
translation: I'll go out for a while and come back when the job is done."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷作如是念：「此為便利而欲出耶？」
translation: Udayin thought, "Is this a convenient way to get out?"

source_sentence: 遂令暫出。
translation: He then ordered them to leave for a while.

source_sentence: 笈多出已撩舉裙衣急走而去。
translation: After he emerged, Gupta lifted up his skirt and hurried away.

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷聞其走聲，即便出外隨後而去，喚言：「禿沙門女，走向何處？」
translation: When Udayinī heard the sound of his departure, he went out after him and called out, "Baldie, where are you going?"

source_sentence: 復更急趁生支觸脾，其精遂泄。
translation: Again, he hastily takes advantage of the growing tendons to contact his spleen, and his semen is then released.

source_sentence: 欲心既歇，徘徊而住。
translation: Once his desire for it had stopped, he wandered off and stayed.

source_sentence: 笈多知已亦復還來，報言：「聖者！
translation: Knowing this, Gṛdhrakūṭa returned and reported, "Sage!

source_sentence: 我若許者，我非苾芻尼，仁非苾芻。」
translation: If I allow it, I'm not a bhikṣuṇī, and my kind is not a bhikṣu."

source_sentence: 鄔陀夷曰：「姊妹！
translation: Udayin said, "Sister!

source_sentence: 如世尊說：『若自護者即是護他，若護他者便成自護。
translation: As the Bhagavān said, 'If someone protects themselves, they're protecting others, and if they protect others, they'll become self-protecting.

source_sentence: 云何自護即是護他？
translation: How does defending oneself mean defending others?'

source_sentence: 自能修習多修習故有所證悟，由斯自護即是護他。
translation: Being able to cultivate it on their own and to cultivate it often leads to awakening, and thus self-protection is protection of others.

source_sentence: 云何護他便成自護？
translation: How does guarding others then become self-protection?

source_sentence: 不惱不恚無怨害心，常起慈悲愍念於物，是名護他便成自護。』」
translation: Not being vexed or angry and having no ill will, always showing compassion and sympathy for things, is called protecting others and then becoming a protector of one's own.'"

source_sentence: 笈多報曰：「聖者！
translation: The Gupta replied, "Sage!

source_sentence: 可脫裙來我當為浣。」
translation: You may take off your skirt and come to me, and I will wash it for you."

source_sentence: 時鄔陀夷即以衣付。
translation: Udayinī then handed over the robe.

source_sentence: 是時笈多見衣精已便生悔心，即便自念：「我之身分未有聖者鄔陀夷不觸不見，我不順彼實非善事。」
translation: Seeing the essence of the robe, Gautama then became remorseful and even thought to himself, "My status hasn't been touched or seen by the noble Udāyin, and it's really not a good thing for me not to obey him."

source_sentence: 作是念已倍發染心，如佛經中說伽他曰：「諸有耽欲人，　　不見於義利，　亦不觀善法，　　常行黑闇中。」
translation: After that thought, he doubly aroused a defiled mind, just as the Buddha's sūtras say about the kathāgata, "There are people who are addicted to desire, who don't see the benefits, don't contemplate the good Dharma, and always walk in darkness."

source_sentence: 時彼笈多欲心亂故，取精一渧置於口中，復取一渧投女根內。
translation: As a result of his desire, that Gṛdhrakūṭa took a drop of semen and put it in his mouth, and then he took another drop and put it into the woman's root.

source_sentence: 有情業力事不思議，時有中蘊有情，是最後生而來依託。
translation: When the karmic power of sentient beings is inconceivable, there are sentient beings in the intermediate aggregate who are ultimately born and come to rely on them.

source_sentence: 笈多至寺便為浣衣。

translation: Kauṣṭhila Ānanda then reprimanded the Śākyamuni monks, "Please stay here, for I will tell the Bhagavān about it."

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀便詣佛所，禮雙足已在一面立，具以其事而白世尊。
translation: Kauśānanda then went to the Buddha, bowed his feet, stood to one side, and explained everything to the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 佛告阿難陀：「可為受取置一大房，并語諸苾芻：若有闕乏資具者隨意取用。」
translation: The Buddha told Ānanda, "You may accept the construction of a large dwelling, and tell the monks, 'If you lack necessities, take them as you like.'"

source_sentence: 時具壽阿難陀唯然受教，即還詣彼諸釋子處，受其所有長衣鉢等，置大房中以為一聚，告諸苾芻曰：「若闕乏者，隨意於此取其衣鉢。」
translation: Accepting his teaching, Kauṣṭhila Ānanda then went back to those Śākyamunis, took all their long robes and bowls, placed them in a large room, and gathered them together as a group, and told the monks, "If you lack them, take their robes and bowls here as you like."

source_sentence: 時諸釋子於彼長衣視如癰箭，既棄捨已遠離多求樂修少欲，即便共往詣世尊所，禮佛足已在一面坐。
translation: The Śākyas then regarded those long robes as like a torn arrow, and having discarded them, they left their numerous pursuits and cultivated few desires, so they went together to the Bhagavān, bowed their heads at the Buddha's feet, and sat to one side.

source_sentence: 根本說一切有部毘奈耶卷第十八
translation: Mūlasarvâstivāda-vinaya, vol. 18
